page.title: 01Woburn and its Environs.
page.content: Woburn is situated on the border of Bedfordshire and Buckinghamshire some 15 miles from Bedford and 8 miles from Leighton Buzzard. The village is surrounded by farmland. Most of the land belongs to the Marquis of Tavistock who lives at Woburn Abbey. The village is small (800 inhabitants) but a number of the houses are of architectural interest and a large number of tourists visit the Abbey every year. Woburn has a number of shops, the majority of which cater for tourists rather than the local residents. The surrounding area is rolling countryside, open to the south and heavily wooded to the north. In recent years a championship golf course has been built in this woodland and now is the venue for major tournaments.
